text:
A block on the periodic table is a group of elements that all have their electrons in the same atomic orbital. There are four blocks, s-, d-, f, and p-. The word "block" was first used to describe this by Charles Janet.
p-block.
The p-block is on the right side of the periodic table. Elements from groups 13-18 are in the p-block.
d-block.
The d-block is in the middle of the periodic table. Elements from groups 3 to 12 are in the d-block.
